data.title: The Bank
data.statement:
Emily works in a bank, she is very hard working and does her job perfectly. But lately, she's been distracted and is starting to fail at even the simplest tasks and that is giving payouts to her clients. She started giving more money than she should and her boss is threatening to fire her!  Help poor Emily keep her job by writing a program that will help her do the payouts.

You are given an amount of money she needs to give to her customer and you need to print out how many banknotes of which value does she need to give. Banknotes available to her are {{500}}, {{200}}, {{100}}, {{50}}, {{20}}, {{10}}, {{5}}, {{2}}, {{1}}, {{0.5}}, {{0.2}} and {{0.1}} EUR.  She will always have enough of each banknote to cover the payout. You need to <<MINIMIZE>> the number of banknotes used. 

For example, if the amount to pay is 1234 EUR. You can used 1234 x 1 EUR bill, but that's not the minimum. The minimum is:
`2 x 500, 1 x 200, 1 x 20, 1 x 10, 2 x 2€

Output format: 
A x B followed by a comma {{,}} or by a EUR sign{{€}} if it's the last banknote (coin) used. There is a space between A and x, between x and B, and after every comma.
A represents the number of banknotes (coins) used, while B is the value of each banknote (i.e. coin)
data.inputDescription: <<Line 1:>> A real number [[N]] for the amount of money.
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1 :>> Best way to pay the money (minimum bills used) or the word {{IMPOSSIBLE}} if it's not possible to pay the amount.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Emily works in a bank, she is very hard working and does her job perfectly. But lately, she's been distracted and is starting to fail at even the simplest tasks and that is giving payouts to her clients. She started giving more money than she should and her boss is threatening to fire her! Help poor Emily keep her job by writing a program that will help her do the payouts.

You are given an amount of money she needs to give to her customer and you need to print out how many banknotes of which value does she need to give. Banknotes available to her are 500, 200, 100, 50, 20, 10, 5, 2, 1, 0.5, 0.2 and 0.1 EUR. She will always have enough of each banknote to cover the payout. You need to MINIMIZE the number of banknotes used.

For example, if the amount to pay is 1234 EUR. You can used 1234 x 1 EUR bill, but that's not the minimum. The minimum is:
`2 x 500, 1 x 200, 1 x 20, 1 x 10, 2 x 2€

Output format:
A x B followed by a comma , or by a EUR sign€ if it's the last banknote (coin) used. There is a space between A and x, between x and B, and after every comma.
A represents the number of banknotes (coins) used, while B is the value of each banknote (i.e. coin)
Input
Line 1: A real number N for the amount of money.
Output
Line 1 : Best way to pay the money (minimum bills used) or the word IMPOSSIBLE if it's not possible to pay the amount.
Constraints
0 ≤ N ≤ 10000000
Example
Input
1234
Output
2 x 500, 1 x 200, 1 x 20, 1 x 10, 2 x 2€
